snippet: Brazil reaffirmed its reputation as a powerhouse of global soccer in the opening match of the World Cup, but its widening political fissures were also on display for an international audience.
abstract: Political discord is on display for international audience as Brazil kicks off opening match at World Cup in Sao Paulo; protests both during and around match reflect anxieties and discontent over economic slowdown, spending on stadiums and reports of corruption involving FIFA, organization that oversees international soccer and World Cup.
lead_paragraph: Brazil reaffirmed its reputation as a powerhouse of global soccer in the opening match of the World Cup, but its widening political fissures were also on display for an international audience.

headline.main: Soccer and Internal Discord, on Display for World to See
headline.print_headline: Soccer and Internal Discord, on Display for World to See
